page.title: 05Stanwell continued
page.content:
All four parks have the usual play grounds installed by the council, Lauser and the Church park are also big enough to play cricket, and on Sundays you can usually find one of the pub teams playing or practising on Lauser Park. Oaks Road is not large enough for cricket, but it does have tennis courts, a bowling green and miniature golf. The tennis are well used in summer and the courts are free, but you have to provide rackets and balls.
Apart from these, Stanwell has no more recreational areas. But, however there is a swimming pool and sports centre nearby in Staines. There are many small green spaces on the housing estates. There is also a water sports centre at Princes Club. By pupils of The Stanwell School
